title: Laura Marqu√©s
text:
Laura Marqu√©s
I am a data scientist and a researcher in ecology and climate science.
I have been working at the University of Bern, at the Geocomputation and Earth Observation group with Prof.¬†Benjamin D. Stocker. My most recent position was Margarita Salas Fellow at the University of Bern and in collaboration with the Cambium Research Group at the University of Valladolid, Spain. I had previously been a postdoc at the Department of Environmental Systems Science at ETH Z√ºrich.
I received my PhD in Forest Ecology at the department of Life Sciences at the University of Alcal√°, Spain.
üì© Contact: lauramarqueslopez@gmail.com
üìÑ Google Scholar
Download My CV

title: Laura Marqu√©s
text: My research have focused on evaluating the impacts of global change on forest ecosystems from a multiscale perspective. My approach includes the use of diverse data in combination with process-based modeling and statistical analyses.

title: Laura Marqu√©s
text: My research have focused on evaluating the impacts of global change on forest ecosystems from a multiscale perspective. My approach includes the use of diverse data in combination with process-based modeling and statistical analyses.

title: Laura Marqu√©s
text:
Data Science
I use R for data management, visualization, and modeling. My workflow includes handling large datasets while ensuring data integrity and reproducibility. I create visualizations to explore trends and communicate findings and apply statistical and computational modeling techniques to extract insights from complex data.

title: Laura Marqu√©s
text:
Resources
You can find more about my work and projects on my GitHub profile.
